page.title: 17TRAFFIC
page.content: THERE ARE{THREE DIFFERENT TYPES}OF ROAD WITHIN THE BLOCK,{MAIN ROADS, {RESIDENTIAL STREETS AND COUNTRY LANES. THE{PRESTBURY ROAD}FORMS PART OF THE MAIN A46 ROUTE TO WINCHCOMBE, STRATFORD UPON AVON AND EVENTUALLY TO LINCOLN. IT CARRIES A LOT OF HEAVY TRAFFIC TO AND FROM THE CENTRE OF CHELTENHAM.{HALES ROAD,}WHICH BECOMES {PRIORS ROAD}AND THEN{BOUNCERS LANE,}IS SIGNPOSTED TO CARRY THROUGH TRAFFIC AWAY FROM THE TOWN CENTRE. THE {RESIDENTIAL STREETS}ARE FAIRLY QUIET WITH THE EXCEPTION OF{CROMWELL ROAD AND{WHADDON ROAD,}WHICH FORM A LINK BETWEEN THE TWO MAIN ROADS. SOME OF THE TRAFFIC IS REQUIRING ACCESS TO THE SHOPS IN WHADDON ROAD AND A GREAT DEAL OF THE MORNING AND LATE AFTERNOON TRAFFIC IS THAT GOING TO AND FROM {G.C.H.Q.}THE HILLS IN THE BLOCK ARE SERVED BY NARROW,{QUIET COUNTRY LANES.
